column4: if you use mediabuntu repo you can install skype from apt-get/synaptic
the ekiga voice quality in the newest version is amazing

skype on ubuntu works well, I use it often

yes but only with skype's protocal I believe

yes, i don't think it's multi-protocal like other aim clients
calling landline/cell phones yes, you'll have to signup for an account but the costs are small
is there a program like AIM that could handle skype and such webcaming/VOIP?
the most recent version of pidgin handles voice/videochat through xmpp
